DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To estimate incidence treatment-related major financial hardship 12 month , among patient newly diagnose metastatic colorectal cancer ( mCRC ) treat component subcomponents National Cancer Institute ( NCI ) Community Oncology Research Program ( NCORP ) . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To describe association major financial hardship mCRC treatment demographic factor , include age , race , marital status , employment status , income . II . To explore whether occurrence major financial hardship associate poor health-related quality life time . III . To profile magnitude time treatment-related change patient ' income , asset , debt , employment , quantify major out-of-pocket expense 12 month follow registration . IV . To explore extent health insurance factor ( e.g . high copayments , deductible , premium , loss/change insurance plan ) associate major financial hardship treatment non-adherence . V. To determine feasibility recruit primary caregiver measure caregiver burden caregiver ' perception cancer treatment cost . VI . To determine feasibility conduct prospective-multi-site longitudinal cohort study assess financial outcome patient mCRC undergoing treatment within NCORP network . TERTIARY OBJECTIVES : I . To obtain objective measure expense , debt credit linkage individual patient credit report ( TransUnion ) enrollment ( baseline ) end follow ( 12 month ) . OUTLINE : Patients complete questionnaire ( include Baseline , Financial/Employment Impact , Insurance Impact , Quality Life , Treatment Perceptions questionnaire ) 30-60 minute baseline 3 , 6 , 9 , 12 month . Caregivers complete questionnaire 30-60 minute baseline 6 12 month .
